sub_topic: Identifying the isomorphism between two graphs.
message_1:
Consider two graphs G and H shown below:

G: 
```
    A---B        E---F
    |   |        |   |
    C---D        G---H
```

H: 
```
    1---2        6---7
    |   |        |   |
    3---4        8---9
```

Determine whether the graphs G and H are isomorphic or not. If they are, provide an isomorphism between the two graphs.
message_2:
The graphs G and H are isomorphic. We can see that both graphs have two disconnected components, each forming a square with 4 vertices and 4 edges. We can provide an isomorphism between the two graphs by mapping the vertices of G to the corresponding vertices of H as follows:

A -> 1
B -> 2
C -> 3
D -> 4
E -> 6
F -> 7
G -> 8
H -> 9

This mapping preserves the adjacency of the vertices, and thus, G and H are isomorphic.
